content:
• Friday, January 4, 2013
  • OPTR

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OPTR +16%. GTI +9%. DSLV +3%. EGLE +2%. GNMK +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OPTR +16%. GTI +9%. DSLV +3%. EGLE +2%. GNMK +2%.
    After-hours top losers: MSPD -8%. CFFN -5%. G -4%. PL -4%. WCRX -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • PSEM

    Tech warnings season is in full swing. Pericom Semi (NASDAQ:PSEM) says it now expects FQ2...

    Tech warnings season is in full swing. Pericom Semi (NASDAQ:PSEM) says it now expects FQ2 revenue of $29M-$30M, below prior guidance of $30.5M-$34.5M and a consensus of $32.6M. Gross margin and opex guidance is unchanged. Pericom, whose signal switching chips go into a wide variety of IT/electronics gear, blames continued demand softness stemming from macro issues. Shares -6.3% AH. Fellow chipmaker Silicon Image warned this morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +14%) finishes the day firmly in the black after Piper Jaffray initiated the...

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +14%) finishes the day firmly in the black after Piper Jaffray initiated the shares earlier today with an Overweight and a $4.00 price target. Piper noted the company's platform for treating diseases by improving muscle function is under-appreciated due to its novelty. Additionally, positive data in its Phase II study for tirasemtiv, a treatment for amyotropic lateral sclerosis. could lead to a partnership or buy-out in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CORT

    Corcept Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CORT) ramps up another 15% today, rising for a second day following...

    Corcept Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CORT) ramps up another 15% today, rising for a second day following an upgrade yesterday by Piper Jaffray and analysts at Janney Capital beginning coverage of the stock with a Buy rating and a $3 price target. CORT climbed just over 10% on Thursday to close at $1.63 a share, its best finish since early November.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF +2%) is finding some big-name defenders in the institutional arena to debunk Bill...

    Herbalife (HLF +2%) is finding some big-name defenders in the institutional arena to debunk Bill Ackman's recent diatribe. Yesterday Chapman Capital's Robert Chapman said that Ackman is going to lose his fight against the company, and he's made HLF his biggest long position. Earlier today Australian hedge fund manager - and traditional short seller - John Hempton joined in, saying that he's also gone long the stock. Hempton contends that HLF may be scumbags, but "they're scumbags who make money ... If you short them, you're going to get run over." (Video)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    More on MBIA (MBI +12%): The judge presiding in the company's suit against Bank of America...

    More on MBIA (MBI +12%): The judge presiding in the company's suit against Bank of America issues a mixed ruling on BofA's request to redact from public record certain documents. On quick read, the ruling doesn't appear to be material to the outcome of the case. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) soars 13.8% amid chatter of an imminent settlement with Bank of America...

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) soars 13.8% amid chatter of an imminent settlement with Bank of America (NYSE:BAC). Update at 3:20 ET: There's no new developments in the case, reports The Street's Dan Freed after speaking with a source close to the legal proceedings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR +2.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $94 price target at...

    Continental Resources (CLR +2.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $94 price target at Deutsche Bank, which views CLR as uniquely positioned, with the dominant Bakken position in the industry, peer leading volume and cash flow growth, and deep resource inventory with significant upside from lower benches and downspacing. The firm sees costs and capital efficiency turning a corner in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • EPRS

    Zalicus (ZLCS) continues its upward trajectory from yesterday, gaining another 3% on the back...

    Zalicus (ZLCS) continues its upward trajectory from yesterday, gaining another 3% on the back yesterday's +15% run after saying it's initiated the second of two Phase 2a clinical studies with Z160, its treatment for chronic neuropathic pain.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • FB

    Some heavily-shorted consumer Internet stocks are closing out the week on a high note. FB +3.4%....

    Some heavily-shorted consumer Internet stocks are closing out the week on a high note. FB +3.4%. ZNGA +8.3%. YELP +6.1%. GRPN +1.9%. Goldman's Heather Bellini is talking up the potential of Facebook's Gifts product, which it began heavily promoting during the holiday season. Assuming Facebook gets a 12% cut on sales, Bellini thinks Gifts could deliver $75M-$110M in 2013 revenue in the event 5% of U.S. users buy an average of 5 gifts over the course of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +4%) moves higher for a second day as a "significant valuation recalibration" is...

    Transocean (RIG +4%) moves higher for a second day as a "significant valuation recalibration" is in order for shares now that most of the uncertainty about potential Deepwater Horizon liabilities has been resolved. RIG shares that lost half their value since the April 2010 blowout are undervalued and "highly attractive" at current prices, Barclays says. The settlement also could bode well for BP (BP +1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +10.8%) spike higher after reports tip off that a deal with Cerberus...

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +10.8%) spike higher after reports tip off that a deal with Cerberus that includes all assets being purchased is close.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • CRNT

    Ceragon (CRNT -5.1%) slips after stating $11M-$14M in revenue expected to be recognized in 2012...

    Ceragon (CRNT -5.1%) slips after stating $11M-$14M in revenue expected to be recognized in 2012 has been pushed out to 2013 due to a customer "requiring additional acceptance procedures and documentation" for purchased equipment. The company adds its net cash position nonetheless rose by $12M-$13M in Q4 thanks to strong collections. Wireless backhaul equipment rival DragonWave (DRWI -1.1%) is down slightly. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • ENMD

    EntreMed (ENMD +8%) gets a pop today after announcing earlier that it has initiated a second...

    EntreMed (ENMD +8%) gets a pop today after announcing earlier that it has initiated a second site at Indiana University for its Phase 2 study of ENMD-2076 in triple-negative breast cancer. Initial studies, supported by a grant from the National Cancer Institute, are already underway at the University of Colorado Cancer Center.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • APKT

    Heavily-shorted Acme Packet (APKT +12.4%) soars on an upgrade to Buy from Stifel, which predicts...

    Heavily-shorted Acme Packet (APKT +12.4%) soars on an upgrade to Buy from Stifel, which predicts sales of Acme's session border controllers will get a big 2013 lift from deployments of VoLTE systems from mobile carriers. Stifel's checks indicate AT&T will likely start deploying VoLTE "in the very near-future," and thinks there are launch dates for 11-13 of the 27 VoLTE projects Acme has said it's a part of. It thinks EPS could jump to $0.65-$0.70 in 2013 (the consensus is at $0.52) and $1 in 2014. Acme fell more than once last year on reports of VoLTE delays. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • SHIP

    Midday top 10 gainers: SHIP +45%. EGLE +36%. GTIM +26%. DRYS +17%. SCTY +14%. UNXL +13%. HNR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SHIP +45%. EGLE +36%. GTIM +26%. DRYS +17%. SCTY +14%. UNXL +13%. HNR +13%. GEVO +12%. APKT +13%. PRGN +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ARAY -20%. SIMG -13%. DRTX -8%. VISN -7%. KGJI -7%. EMMS -7%. FINL -6%. ALIM -6%. SPRT -6%. GRZ -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -1%) takes its cue and trades lower on a downgrade at Wedbush to Neutral, despite...

    Illumina (ILMN -1%) takes its cue and trades lower on a downgrade at Wedbush to Neutral, despite an upgrade by Piper Jaffray earlier in the day. Wedbush says it's chatted with several typical sequencing customers recently that are either putting off or second guessing HiSeq purchases due to rumors of units coming for sale on the secondary market at steep discounts. Piper on the other hand raised its rating to Overweight, noting that its sees next-gen sequencing share gains for ILMN, with its HiSeq installed base increasing by 13.2% Y/Y and MiSeq growing by 101.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • AAPL

    Deutsche's U.S. team follows up on an overnight note from the firm's Japanese unit about iPhone...

    Deutsche's U.S. team follows up on an overnight note from the firm's Japanese unit about iPhone production cuts by declaring Apple's (AAPL -2%) stock "has digested this supply chain issue and likely has lower unit production already priced in." Notable Calls is encouraged by this due to the track record of the analyst in question (presumably Chris Whitmore). Apple has bounced a little off its session lows. Cirrus Logic (CRUS -3.8%) and Skyworks (SWKS -2.9%) are faring worse.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 27 Comments
  • HLF

    Hello Herbalife: Bill Ackman's Pershing Square rises 5.8% in December - largely on the back of...

    Hello Herbalife: Bill Ackman's Pershing Square rises 5.8% in December - largely on the back of his very public outing of the stock - turning a lackluster 2012 into something better. Pershing is raising money for a publicly traded fund and this should improve the prospectus. HLF has bounced nearly 50% in the past handful of sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD -1.8%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at Piper Jaffray on concerns that Q4...

    Cepheid (CPHD -1.8%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at Piper Jaffray on concerns that Q4 results and its FY13 outlook could both miss expectations. The company suffered two manufacturing glitches in FY12 that impacted its ability to meet customer cartridge demand in Q3. This created a backlog and the need to put accounts on allocation as management resolved the issue. Piper thinks CPHD may have missed its end of November allocation target. The firm also cut its price target to $34 from $42.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (IPGP -6%) trades lower following a downgrade to Hold from Stifel. The firm cites...

    IPG Photonics (IPGP -6%) trades lower following a downgrade to Hold from Stifel. The firm cites IPG's valuation - the company has seen a decent run-up from its summer lows - and a belief the industrial laser maker will see tougher competition and slowing earnings growth in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -1.5%) reaffirms its Q4 outlook in its conference call today,...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -1.5%) reaffirms its Q4 outlook in its conference call today, saying it still expects an EPS of $1.18 to $1.23, which is below analyst estimates of $1.25, on revenues of about $900M, also below the Street view of $970.58. For FY13, it sees an EPS of between $5.45 - $5.75, in line with the $5.53 consensus, with revenues of $4.4B to $4.8B, also in line with the $4.84B consensus. (Conference Call Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy (SN +5.1%) initiated with a Buy rating at C.K. Cooper, which notes SN is in the...

    Sanchez Energy (SN +5.1%) initiated with a Buy rating at C.K. Cooper, which notes SN is in the early stages of developing its properties and is focused on an oil-weighted Eagle Ford development program. The firm finds significant upside in the shares as SN rapidly accelerates its drilling program and grows its reserves, production and cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • WINT

    Discovery Labs (DSCO -2.1%) dips after it says W. Thomas Amick has resigned as Chairman and CEO....

    Discovery Labs (DSCO -2.1%) dips after it says W. Thomas Amick has resigned as Chairman and CEO. In his stead, the board has appointed John G. Cooper as President and CEO and has been elected to the Company's board of directors, while John R. Leone is appointed Chairman of the board.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN -1.2%) slips a bit this morning after saying late yesterday that 2013 revenue...

    InterMune (ITMN -1.2%) slips a bit this morning after saying late yesterday that 2013 revenue from sales of Esbriet will depend largely on the timing of its launch efforts in several European countries. The drug is designed for the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, a progressive and fatal lung disease and is the only approved treatment worldwide.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • EGLE

    Shipping firms trade higher in frenzied action tied to a strong outlook for shipping rates in...

    Shipping firms trade higher in frenzied action tied to a strong outlook for shipping rates in 2013. Despite the rush, many analysts warn the sector is a place for investors to look to "rent" stocks instead of buy and hold. Advancers: EGLE +40.5%, EXM +26.5%, DRYS +12.2%, PRGN +7.8%, ESEA +7.5%, DSX +6.1%, GNK +8.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • ENDP

    Endo Health Solutions (ENDP -4.5%) trades lower after cutting its 2013 guidance yesterday due to...

    Endo Health Solutions (ENDP -4.5%) trades lower after cutting its 2013 guidance yesterday due to higher charges related to its core painkiller franchise and generic-drug business. It now expects its EPS to be within a range of $4.40 to $4.70 a share, down from earlier projections of $5.20 to $5.40. Revenue is projected between $2.8B to $2.95B, below previous estimates of $3B to $3.2B. Piper Jaffray cut the shares to Neutral on the news, and lowers its price target to $28.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (ANGO +2.3%) moves up after FQ2 earnings beat bottom line estimates by a penny on...

    AngioDynamics (ANGO +2.3%) moves up after FQ2 earnings beat bottom line estimates by a penny on an 89% Y/Y jump in vascular sales. Net profit slipped 15% Y/Y however, as higher input costs and expenses in its oncology division offset the sales gains. The company also lowered its FY13 revenue guidance to between $355M and $360M, down from its October view of revenue of $361M to $ 364M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +2.9%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm sees the Wi-Fi...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +2.9%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm sees the Wi-Fi equipment vendor experiencing re-accelerating growth in 2013 thanks to the "bring your own device" (BYOD) trend and the success of its ClearPass software, which manages network access. Oppenheimer made similar arguments for Aruba last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • BCEI

    Bonanza Creek Energy (BCEI +8.6%) plans to spend $394M in 2013 to achieve average annual...

    Bonanza Creek Energy (BCEI +8.6%) plans to spend $394M in 2013 to achieve average annual production of 14,500-16,000 boe/day, exceeding prior estimates. BCEI also ramps up its rig count in the Wattenberg field from two to four by early Q2 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • AIG

    AIG investors are no doubt pleased after a big 2012, and an especially nice run since the...

    AIG investors are no doubt pleased after a big 2012, and an especially nice run since the Treasury exited a month ago. A popular play for many AIG bulls, however, are the TARP warrants - struck at $45 and expiring in 2021. Generally rising and falling with the stock, the warrants have remained stuck in neutral of late.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 6 Comments
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett (BBG -6.3%) sets an initial 2013 capital expense budget of $475M-$525M vs....

    Bill Barrett (BBG -6.3%) sets an initial 2013 capital expense budget of $475M-$525M vs. estimated $900M-$950M in 2012 and well below Street estimates, and a production range of 83-87 Bcfe. BBG plans to generate 55% Y/Y oil production growth in 2013, or ~30% of total equivalent production, and includes drilling ~150 gross operated wells.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • SFLY

    TechCrunch passes on a rumor Shutterfly (SFLY +3.1%) is "set to acquire" photo sharing/storage...

    TechCrunch passes on a rumor Shutterfly (SFLY +3.1%) is "set to acquire" photo sharing/storage site ThisLife for ~$25M. In addition to regular PC photo uploading, ThisLife supports the automatic importing of a user's images on popular photo-sharing sites such as Facebook, Instagram, and Flickr. In 2012, Shutterfly digested Kodak Gallery and photo ranking/analysis tool developer Photoccino.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM

  • Interesting action in the precious metals had them continuing overnight a sharp fall begun after...

    Interesting action in the precious metals had them continuing overnight a sharp fall begun after FOMC minutes suggested an earlier-than-expected end to Fed candy. This reversed with the 8:30 jobs report which showed still-sluggish employment growth. Gold has since bounced $21 to $1,651, though still off 1.4% on the session. Silver jumps $0.70, but remains -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 26 Comments
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR -6%) moves lower after an abrupt CEO shakeup rattles investors. Traders don't...

    Coinstar (CSTR -6%) moves lower after an abrupt CEO shakeup rattles investors. Traders don't seem to be blown away with the firm's new outlook for Q4 profit with a good chunk of the lift to the high end of prior guidance coming from a tax benefit.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image (SIMG -8.7%) opens down sharply after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $59M-$60M,...

    Silicon Image (SIMG -8.7%) opens down sharply after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $59M-$60M, below prior guidance of $64M-$67M and a consensus of $65.7M. The chipmaker blames "the rescheduling of certain orders by a large customer," and says it expects Q1 product sales to be up Q/Q. Is that "large customer" Samsung? SIMG supplies MHL video transmitter chips for the Galaxy S III and other Samsung smartphones. Other key Samsung chip suppliers include MXIM, SWKS, BRCM, and ADNC.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) +10.6% premarket after the biopharma company announces...

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) +10.6% premarket after the biopharma company announces positive preliminary results from all four dose cohorts in a phase 2 study of its treatment for Pompe disease, a lysosomal storage disease characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and respiratory insufficiency.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • FOLD

    Premarket gainers: FOLD +10%. ALU +7%. HNR +6%. GEVA +5%. Losers: ARAY -29%.

    Premarket gainers: FOLD +10%. ALU +7%. HNR +6%. GEVA +5%.
    Losers: ARAY -29%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) +5.4% premarket after announcing a new oil discovery...

    Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) +5.4% premarket after announcing a new oil discovery offshore Gabon via a well at the Tortue Marin prospect in the Dussafu field in the pre-salt Gamba and Dentale formations. Shares also could be ticking higher as speculation about the deteriorating health of Venezuelan president Hugo Chavez makes the rounds, as more than half of HNR's assets are in the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    The quick analyst take on Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) is that this morning's stinging downgrade from...

    The quick analyst take on Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) is that this morning's stinging downgrade from Credit Suisse could be the domino that precipitates a lingering fall in share price. After a considerable amount of anecdotal discussion over the retailer's promotional activity, the investment firm has come out with something a little bit meatier for bears to sink their teeth into. LULU -5.9% premarket to $72.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • FINL

    Athletic shoe sellers are on watch after Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) puts in a disappointing...

    Athletic shoe sellers are on watch after Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) puts in a disappointing quarter and warns on changing trends in the sector. Is the era of +$200 basketball shoes over? Premarket: FINL -7.9%, FL -2.1%, DKS -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) drop 3.7% premarket with a harsh downgrade from Credit Suisse...

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) drop 3.7% premarket with a harsh downgrade from Credit Suisse starting to resonate. The stance from the firm is that the yoga apparel seller will continue to see challenges in driving incremental sales in mature stores. It also notes a scan of the retailer's website reveals that by the end of the December close to 20% of Lululemon's products were on sale, compared to just 8% in mid-month.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar is cut to Sell at Raymond James, with analyst Pavel Molchanov calling the recent big...

    First Solar is cut to Sell at Raymond James, with analyst Pavel Molchanov calling the recent big move in the stock (and solar overall) "another solar junk rally." It's a carbon copy of last year's surge around this time, he says. "Here is how that movie ended: The index ended down 33% for the year." FSLR -3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM | 4 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) reports its holiday season sales rose 23.2% Y/Y to $475.6M with...

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) reports its holiday season sales rose 23.2% Y/Y to $475.6M with comparable store sales up a solid 7.4%. Due to the strong results, the company reaffirms its Q4 guidance. ULTA -2.0% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • LLY

    Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) sees 2013 EPS of $3.75-$3.90 vs. Street consensus of $3.72. Shares +1%...

    Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) sees 2013 EPS of $3.75-$3.90 vs. Street consensus of $3.72. Shares +1% premarket. Conference call is set for 9 ET.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • TM

    Japan parties in its first session of the new year, the Nikkei gaining 2.8% to its highest close...

    Japan parties in its first session of the new year, the Nikkei gaining 2.8% to its highest close since March 2011. Leading the gains were exporters, including Toyota (NYSE:TM) +6.4%, catching up to big gains in the States over the past week. The slide in the yen picks up steam, the dollar +1.2% and buying ¥88.25. Hedged vs. unhedged Japan stock ETFs over the past 3 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM

  • The dollar is higher against euro (+0.2%), yen (+0.8%) and pound (+0.25%) following the FOMC...

    The dollar is higher against euro (+0.2%), yen (+0.8%) and pound (+0.25%) following the FOMC minutes yesterday, while oil is -0.7%, gold -2.1% and silver -4.2%. "The range of views on the likely timing of the completion of asset purchases was apparently sooner than market expectations," says Barclays.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 AM | 2 Comments

  • European shares are broadly lower following the surprisingly hawkish bent of the FOMC minutes...

    European shares are broadly lower following the surprisingly hawkish bent of the FOMC minutes and ahead of U.S job figures later today. EU Stoxx 50 -0.2%, London -0.1%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.1%, Milan flat, Madrid +0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 AM

  • Asian stocks are mixed after the Fed put a dampener on proceedings by signaling that its QE...

    Asian stocks are mixed after the Fed put a dampener on proceedings by signaling that its QE isn't going to last forever after all. Japan roars higher as it plays catch-up following its return from a week-long break during which the U.S. fiscal cliff was averted and the yen weakened considerably, giving a boost to export stocks. Japan +2.8%, Hong Kong -0.5%, China +0.3%, India -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 AM
